byline.contributor: Sarah Maslin Nir and Liam Stack contributed reporting.
byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN and MIREYA NAVARRO

abstract: Lawyer for Maria Hrynenko, owner of two of three buildings leveled in East Village explosion and fire, deflects blame for incident toward Consolidated Edison, utility that provides gas to area; move follows discovery that Hrynenko had received warning of possible gas leak from commercial tenant, and failed to report it to Con Ed, instead sending her con and a contractor to investigate.
lead_paragraph: Thomas M. Curtis, a lawyer for Maria Hrynenko, questioned the actions of Con Edison, which had two inspectors in the basement of one of the destroyed buildings shortly before the explosion in the East Village last week.

headline.main: Landlord’s Lawyer Blames Con Ed in East Village Explosion
headline.print_headline: Landlord’s Lawyer Blames Con Ed in Fatal Blast

snippet: Thomas M. Curtis, a lawyer for Maria Hrynenko, questioned the actions of Con Edison, which had two inspectors in the basement of one of the destroyed buildings shortly before the explosion in the East Village last week.
